Select the element name.

Tap or click the Menu button from the upper right side corner (or swipe from right to left on mobile devices). A side panel is displayed.
Select the Attributes tab. The attributes side panel is displayed. Web Author Attribute Side Panel

If the attribute is present in the attributes table (it already has a value), you can change its value by tapping or clicking its value. On a desktop system, you can also use Tab or Shift+Tab to cycle through the available attributes and the Enter key to select and modify attribute values.

If the attribute is not present, use the Add Attribute button and tap or click the attribute to set its value. On a desktop system, you can also press when the cursor is in the document and the focus will change to the Attributes tab with the Add Attribute form control automatically opened.

Find the attribute in the table and tap or click its value.
Use the Delete button (or use the Delete key) to remove the attribute.

section.title: Save a modified XML document
section.p: To save your changes, tap or click the Save button from the upper toolbar. Note that the open and save operations depend on the integration of the with a CMS or other storage mechanism.

ol.li: Tap or click the Find/Replace button from the upper toolbar, or the Rind/Replace tab.
The Find/Replace side panel is opened. Type the text you want to find in the Search for input box and tap or click the Find button in the left side of that same input box.
All matches are highlighted, and the first one is selected. To advance to the next match, tap or click the Find button again.
To replace content, type the new text in the Replace with input box. To replace the current match, use the Replace button. To replace all matches, use the Replace all button.
Tap or click the equation to open an editing dialog box.
Edit the XML source of the equation.
Tap or click OK to finish the editing process.

section.title: Promote/Demote List Item Nodes
section.p:
In the desktop version of , you can easily promote or demote list item nodes within ordered lists or unordered lists by using the following keyboard shortcuts:
Promote ()
Promotes the current list item node to be a sibling of its parent node (the list item is moved to the left). It also works for selections of multiple list item nodes as long as all the selected nodes are siblings (on the same hierarchical level).
Demote ()
Demotes the current list item node (the list item is moved to the right). It also works for selections of multiple list item nodes as long as all the selected nodes are siblings (on the same hierarchical level).
